FieldDefinition.description: Strategy to determine health
FieldDefinition.name: reportingStrategy

ServiceDefinition.description: Create a CSV file containing a subpopulation of the dataset based on the profiles result
ServiceDefinition.name: CreateCSVForProfileSubpopulation

FieldDefinition.description: ID for a specific profile within the job results. The subpopulation will be generated based on this profile. The initial profileId is 0. The specified profile must not contain n-gram fields.
FieldDefinition.name: profileId

FieldDefinition.description: ID of the profiles job result from which to generate the subpopulation. The profiles job must be run on a parquet dataset with allowOverlap enabled.
FieldDefinition.name: profilesJobId

FieldDefinition.description: Queryable tags associated with this job
FieldDefinition.name: tags

ServiceDefinition.description: Identify populations in the data that maximize or minimize the specified goal
ServiceDefinition.name: CreateJob

FieldDefinition.description: Indicates whether profiles can overlap or must be mutually exclusive. True = profiles can overlap. False = profiles must be mutually exclusive. Default = False.
FieldDefinition.name: allowOverlap

FieldDefinition.description: beamWidth - Determines the width of the profiles search. The smaller the width, the narrower the search for improvements. A larger width may find a more accurate result but can slow the algorithm. (1 - 50, Default = 5)
FieldDefinition.name: beamWidth

FieldDefinition.description: binningStrategy - Indicates which binning technique is used to fine-tune the profiles search in continuous data (uniform, density, Default = uniform). Uniform = bins are all of equal width. Density = bin width is determined so that each bin has an equal number of records.
FieldDefinition.name: binningStrategy

FieldDefinition.description: For a Categorical goal, select the category to be optimized for profile generation (required).
FieldDefinition.name: categoryToOptimize

FieldDefinition.description: Reference to the dataset for this job
FieldDefinition.name: datasetRef

FieldDefinition.description: Optional description for this job
FieldDefinition.name: description

FieldDefinition.description: The field to be minimized or maximized
FieldDefinition.name: goalName

FieldDefinition.description: Name for this job
FieldDefinition.name: jobName

FieldDefinition.description: Maximum number of conditions to include in a profile (1 - 50. affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxDepth

FieldDefinition.description: Maximize or minimize the goal field?
FieldDefinition.name: maximize

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the maximum size (in consecutive words) of n-grams (words or phrases) that can be used as features (affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxNGramSize

FieldDefinition.description: Maximum number of profiles to generate (1 - 100. affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxProfileCount

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the maximum number of different n-grams of each size that can be used as features
FieldDefinition.name: maxVocabSize

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the minimum fraction of dataset rows in which an n-gram must appear in order to be used. Allowed values are 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive)
FieldDefinition.name: minDocumentFrequency

FieldDefinition.description: Percentage below which a population will not be considered a profile (0 - 1)
FieldDefinition.name: minPopulationPercentage

FieldDefinition.description: Queryable tags associated with this job
FieldDefinition.name: tags

FieldDefinition.description: Indicates which method is used to determine optimal profiles. True = Use Z Scores (standard deviations from the mean, corrected by the sample population). False = Use Distance from the Mean. Default = True
FieldDefinition.name: useZScores

ServiceDefinition.description: Identify populations in the data that maximize or minimize the specified goal, with one or more equivalent sets of conditions describing each population
ServiceDefinition.name: CreateSynonymousJob

FieldDefinition.description: Indicates whether profiles can overlap or must be mutually exclusive. True = profiles can overlap. False = profiles must be mutually exclusive. Default = False.
FieldDefinition.name: allowOverlap

FieldDefinition.description: beamWidth - Determines the width of the profiles search. The smaller the width, the narrower the search for improvements. A larger width may find a more accurate result but can slow the algorithm. (1 - 50, Default = 5)
FieldDefinition.name: beamWidth

FieldDefinition.description: binningStrategy - Indicates which binning technique is used to fine-tune the profiles search in continuous data (uniform, density, Default = uniform). Uniform = bins are all of equal width. Density = bin width is determined so that each bin has an equal number of records.
FieldDefinition.name: binningStrategy

FieldDefinition.description: For a Categorical goal, select the category to be optimized for profile generation (required).
FieldDefinition.name: categoryToOptimize

FieldDefinition.description: Reference to the dataset for this job
FieldDefinition.name: datasetRef

FieldDefinition.description: Optional description for this job
FieldDefinition.name: description

FieldDefinition.description: The field to be minimized or maximized
FieldDefinition.name: goalName

FieldDefinition.description: Name for this job
FieldDefinition.name: jobName

FieldDefinition.description: Maximum number of conditions to include in a profile (1 - 50. affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxDepth

FieldDefinition.description: Maximize or minimize the goal field?
FieldDefinition.name: maximize

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the maximum size (in consecutive words) of n-grams (words or phrases) that can be used as features (affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxNGramSize

FieldDefinition.description: Maximum number of profiles to generate (1 - 100. affects runtime)
FieldDefinition.name: maxProfileCount

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the maximum number of different n-grams of each size that can be used as features
FieldDefinition.name: maxVocabSize

FieldDefinition.description: For TEXT fields, the minimum fraction of dataset rows in which an n-gram must appear in order to be used. Allowed values are 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive)
FieldDefinition.name: minDocumentFrequency

FieldDefinition.description: Percentage below which a population will not be considered a profile (0 - 1)
FieldDefinition.name: minPopulationPercentage

FieldDefinition.description: Queryable tags associated with this job
FieldDefinition.name: tags

FieldDefinition.description: Indicates which method is used to determine optimal profiles. True = Use Z Scores (standard deviations from the mean, corrected by the sample population). False = Use Distance from the Mean. Default = True
FieldDefinition.name: useZScores

ServiceDefinition.description: Retrieve results of a profiles subpopulation job (not safe for large datasets, use SaveJobResults instead)
ServiceDefinition.name: RetrieveProfileSubpopulation

ResultType.description: A subpopulation based on a profile
ResultType.name: profileSubpopulation

FieldDefinition.description: ID of the profiles subpopulation job result to retrieve
FieldDefinition.name: jobId

ServiceDefinition.description: Retrieve results of a profiling job
ServiceDefinition.name: RetrieveResult

ResultType.description: List of discovered population profiles with conditions and statistics
ResultType.name: dataProfiles

FieldDefinition.description: ID of the job result to retrieve
FieldDefinition.name: jobId

FieldDefinition.description: Optional locale for field names and categorical values in the returned result
FieldDefinition.name: locale

ServiceDefinition.description: Retrieve results of a synonymous profiling job
ServiceDefinition.name: RetrieveSynonymousResult

ResultType.description: List of discovered population profiles with conditions and statistics
ResultType.name: dataProfiles

FieldDefinition.description: ID of the job result to retrieve
FieldDefinition.name: jobId

FieldDefinition.description: Optional locale for field names and categorical values in the returned result
FieldDefinition.name: locale
